Name: SEEDJEN
Title: A beautiful & impressive heritage site
Review: This tomb of the Mughal emperor Humayun, an almost 500 year old UNESCO site is a very impressive place in scale  and design. You will marvel at the skilled craftsmanship of the work on show in trellis stone lattice windows & geometric designs, and ingenuity of the Persian architecture of Mirak Mirza Ghiyas. It is set in a large garden with some very old trees dotted around creating an oasis of peace juxtaposed with the busy city streets outside. There are other interesting structures to visit in the complex.

Name: David D
Title: The first of the great Mughal era tombs.
Review: Humayun inherited the Mughal Empire, then lost it, fled into exile with his wife and a small group of soldiers, made friends with the Safavid Shah of Persia and traded a priceless diamond for an army, which he then used to take his empire back. He trusted everyone around him and nearly everyone betrayed his trust, but despite his trusting nature, he died the prosperous ruler of one of the largest empires on earth at the time. His wife went on the Haij pilgrimage to Mecca and then built this tomb in his honour from her own treasures. The tomb complex is also historically important in that it was where the last Mughal Emperor was actually captured by the British in 1857. The tomb complex also houses other tombs, such as those of Isa Khan, who predated Humayun’s rule in Delhi.

Name: Ambassador435631
Title: Beautiful monument
Review: A very beautiful monument, so huge, the grounds are beautiful as well. We could have easily spent 3-4 hours marvelling at this wonder. Don't miss this!

Name: Hanzik von Tutenschwarz
Title: Baby Taj Mahal that's worth the price
Review: Very interesting experience. The area is quite well maintained. Takes around an hour or two to walk around. You can go all the way inside the tomb. Around 50 Rs for locals, 600 Rs for foreigners (I think it's 550 Rs if you buy the ticket online, but I don't know where you can do that). You can take everything with you, there seems to be no restrictions on cameras and bags.Combined with a visit to the Sunder Nursery across the street, this was a lovely afternoon.

Name: Shil P
Title: Great history
Review: Such beautiful grounds that we didn't realize the importance of and almost didn't stop to see. I highly recommend paying a little extra for one of the official tour guides. The history of the moghuls who came to India and this site being the inspiration for the Taj Mahal was just amazing. Highly recommend this on your tour of Delhi.

Name: Anika S
Title: A monument built by Emperor Humayun's wife in his memory.
Review: Humayun's tomb is the tomb of the Mughal Emperor Humayun .It is a monument built by his wife in his memory. It is UNESCO world heritage site and was built before the more renowned and another famous Mughal monument Taj Mahal. It's ay Nizamuddin area near the mosque opp Sunder Nursery.

Name: Majdalina
Title: Beautiful
Review: Taj Mahal precursor - with over 100 tombsGo before 4:00 PM because some gates inside close by 5:00 PM although it remains open to visitors

Name: Sarah Afker
Title: Oh the architecture
Review: This is a breathtaking mausoleum in the hub of Central Delhi. The architecture is splendid and I would recommend carrying water and being wary of fake guides and pick pocketers. This is a must see when in Delhi, nothing quite made my trip than the visit to the Humayun's Tomb

Name: singhasam
Title: The first garden tomb on the Indian sub-continent.
Review: THIS is the tomb of the Mughal emperor Humayun.It was built in 1570, is the first garden tomb on the Indian sub-continent and the site is a Unesco World Heritage monument.When you arrive you walk into the site through an archway flanked by trees.Visitors then walk down a stone drive towards the main tomb area which can be viewed on several levels.Times are different post-Covid and all the waterways around the site which used to be full are currently empty on Government orders as part of efforts to combat the virus. You have to imagine the tinkle of water or the look of reflections.The main white marble dome is impressive and rises more than 150ft.It is possible to climb very steep stone steps to get out on to a terrace overlooking the gardens, but be warned. There are handrails but the climb needs care particularly if you are elderly or disabled.Inside the main building itself are several tombs with graceful stone and marble work and fretted stone windows.The structure is a combination of Persian, Turkish and Indian architecture and was commissioned by Humayun's first wife and consort, the Empress Bega Begum.Keep an eye out when you wander round the gardens because a wealth of birdlife lives there. I even saw a Brown Kite come down to drink at a point where lawns were being watered.A very peaceful place and well worth a visit.

Name: Woodstag
Title: Great Mughal Tomb Garden Place to visit
Review: Interesting place to visit and explore this first garden Mughal tomb built in memory of his wife and inspired several major architectural innovations, culminating in the construction of the Taj Mahal and other Mughal architectures. Great place to walk around and having a guide to explain the history.

Name: vyasch
Title: A different in the line of Mughal monuments
Review: A different in the line of Mughal monuments, commissioned by a wife in memory of her husband. It gives a little sad feeling when one circles around the tomb.A very few structure has this good platform. The structure looks the same from all the side, surprisingly and unfortunately.Had this monument been built in marble, it would have been one of the seven wonders of the world but perhaps, it doesn't have the kind of legends the Taj Mahal has with it.

Name: Smarthitech
Title: Wastage of Money
Review: If anyone is planning to go there please don't. According to my experience, you should only go there when you think that it is an ancient monument and must visit once otherwise there is no fun even a park is better than this and let me make you clear you need to pay 40 rs per person if you go there, Instead, I will suggest you the newly developed park just opposite Humayun's tomb and that will be more enjoying.

Name: AlGr1990
Title: Interesting
Review: Interesting place to explore. Nice museum explains the conservation efforts. Spend a couple of hours here. Sunset brings out the colour of the stone well.

Name: Wanderlust Family
Title: Awe inspiring architecture, culture & history
Review: One of the most impressive sites & must visit monuments of the Mughal Empire. A Beautiful love story, awe inspiring architecture, culture and a divine aura of an ancient an opulent past. It really is amazing, so much to soak in & see. The good thing about this place is unlike Taj Mahal, it is not so crowded.

Name: Federico
Title: A must-see in Delhi!
Review: A must-see landmark in Delhi.Humayun's Tomb compares to the Taj Mahal in Agra, sharing a lot of architectural similarities and deep roots in the Mughal dynasty.Highly recommend to hire a guide to fully appreciate the history behind the site.

Name: Travellertohelp
Title: What a beauty..!
Review: I'm leaving full stars review for this monument because Humayun's Tomb exceeded my expectations. My experience for the first time in mughal monument after the Taj and I'm pretty impressed.For me is still a big question in my mind how they built these massive monuments back in the days.All of them are just Wow factor.

Name: Marc R
Title: favorite thing to see during layover
Review: Great pictures here, well managed. A security guard did follow me around wanting to take my picture for tip money, midday the sun could be intense and right outside the entrance lot of local people trying to aggressively sell you souvenirs, which could be overwhelming.

Name: Lakshmi Biradar
Title: Great Asian and Persian architecture
Review: Humayun's tomb is the tomb of the Mughal Emperor Humayun in Delhi. It was the first garden-tomb on the India. It was also the first structure to use red sandstone at such a scale. It which houses the graves of Empress Bega Begum, Hamida Begum, and also Dara Shikoh, great-great-grandson of Humayun and son of the later Emperor Shah Jahan. It designed using Asian and Persian architecture.

Name: pragati9
Title: Uncrowded and well maintained.
Review: Uncrowded,calm and magnificent.Worth visiting solo or with family.Maintaince is good though the stairs leading to first floor are bit high and can cause problem to small kids and elderly visitors.An interactive tour using VR or audio guide or video  presentation to relate History of the place would make it more attractive to students and others too.

Name: AnisMajid
Title: Amazing tour to the old & new Delhi
Review: Have a great experience to have a tour in the hiatorical place in Delhi.Our tour guide Mr Sunil help us to explore the old & the new delhi.Thanks so much for the great hospitality and really recommended to have Mr Sunil as your tour guide.

Name: Ella
Title: Amazing place
Review: Humayun the second of great Mughal ruler honored his favorite barber with a beautiful tomb, located next to his very own magnificent mausoleum.Its proximity to the main tomb and the fact that it is the only other structure within the main tomb complex suggests its importance, however there are no inscriptions suggesting as to who is interred therein, the name Barbers tomb is the local name of the structure, hence still in use.

Name: pri12
Title: Nice
Review: Nothing much great.it just tomb of humayun...nice garden..ticket are there for entry..half an hour is ok..beautifuly constructed

Name: Abhay
Title: Must visit in Delhi
Review: A beautiful memorial place with lots to see around and relax in the parks. Can be done on your own but if you want to dive into history, do hire a guide.Though, not recommended to visit in Summer.

Name: AlnmouthFan
Title: Variety of building to look round
Review: Lots to see and wander around on your own. No need for guides. Good shady areas to rest from heat and really relaxed place.

Name: Michaela B
Title: Beautiful monument and interesting tour
Review: We had a guide as part of our tour and it was very informative and helpful. By yourself, you can appreciate the site, but not the history so much.

Name: Bade C
Title: Amazing place
Review: I visited Humayun tomb 2nd time or more then that,. All time it is best favourite place for me❣️Nace Nature vew and place is in peace.Best place for visit with family and friends.Must visit here.

Name: Ron
Title: Interesting but needs some TLC
Review: It’s surprising to see monument of this magnitude in center of Delhi in rather poor shape. Government should spend some money to spruce up this place. Overall Delhi is least impressive of the golden triangle places.

Name: EastTNVol
Title: Rich Cultural Experience, in the Heart of Delhi
Review: This was a very interesting site to visit.  Several people to whom I sent photos assumed it was the Taj Mahal, which allowed for a discussion on the differences between the two sites.  I especially enjoyed comparing the two sites, with the differences between the red stone and white marble.  Note when planning a visit that the stairs leading up to the building are very steep.

Name: Achal N
Title: Beautiful, Relaxing Monument
Review: Beautiful monument indeed. Looks more like a mini Taj Mahal of a different shade. The surroundings of the monument are well maintained and clean. Outside the compound it's a whole different story. Good place to walk around and rest too. There's also another tomb at the entrance with another small monument. If you're not planning on relaxing, nothing much to do here. Avoid visiting during afternoons, extreme heat. The entrance and the route leading upto the monument could've been slightly better. There was some sort of construction/renovation works going on at a stretch, things might be better now.

Name: Moniesha V
Title: Could skip it
Review: Firstly, it isn't well maintained. There is no water as shown in the picture. It is just a good place to take a stroll and some pictures and nothing much. The only thing I liked there was the upper area (terrace) and the view that you get of the entire place. The inside of the tomb is blocked.

Name: Niket Kumar Dixit
Title: Must visit, but place can be better managed.
Review: Had really high hopes from this place as always saw this place in history books. However, got really pained by the mismanagement at this Unesco world heritage. Guides were not there. However, still recommend this for a quick visit.

Name: Shubhanshu B
Title: Absolutely Amazing!
Review: A clean, green and serene place in the middle of the city. Truly grand at scale that can't be imagined from its photos/videos. Easy to reach from JLN metro station (the nearest), there are absolutely no prearrangements required. Can scan and pay for tickets at the entry (Rs 70 for Indians). Carry essential food/water as there is no kiosk/eateries inside the complex. Washroom facility is available. Guards double down as guides and happy to share what they know about history. Maps/artefacts/stories have been maintained to make it historically interesting. The best part is access to first floor of the main tomb (huge open area with great visibility, ideal for winters). Rich artistic roof work and intricate wall angles make it an architectural marvel. People not comfortable with steep stairs and long walks may want to avoid. Ideal for dates, families, shoots, and spending quiet quality time. Overall, a fulfilling 2 hour place :)

Name: Laura R
Title: Honest doorman
Review: It is a great construction and a very beautiful place to visit! I payed the full fee but then the doorman came running after me and gave me my money back because tourist come in for free that day.... that was such an honest thing yo do 😊 very nice

Name: Jon
Title: Our favorite sight in Delhi!
Review: What a great place to visit - as many others have said, it is an oasis of calm and beauty.  The architecture is fantastic and surrounding buildings and tombs are equally lovely.   While everyone is struggling for the perfect picture from the entrance side, be patient and walk all the way around the building from the same distance - you’ll find fantastic views with fewer/no people in your shots!  Great history to boot - read up a bit first to truly appreciate just how special this place is.

Name: Vaidehi15
Title: A place for History lovers
Review: Beautiful Memorial place to visit. Especially if you are fond of understanding the history & love watching beautiful view.It requires around 1 hour to see the complete site. Do plan your visit with other monuments, as all can be covered together.

Name: Avik Mukherjee
Title: A must visit place
Review: The first Mughal architecture in India, developed by great Akbar. And the same was copied at Taj Mahal.  A must visit Entry ticket is there

Name: Maximilian
Title: Nice but the prices for Foreigners are to high!
Review: The place is really fantastic!It’s a huge area with great parks and a lot of animals. Why I only give 3 Stars? Because the price for tourists are 12x times higher then for locals and you are not allowed to bring a small attached microphone on your camera! Sorry guys that makes no sense!And advertising with a discount 50 Rupies of by Card Payment but not providing the Option is a real no go!

Name: Fran-Svk
Title: Nice place
Review: Very nice place (cause it is quiet and clean;). First of all wanna say that this area contains several ancient buildings: Humayun's tomb, Barber's tomb, Nila Gumbad, Isa Khan Mausoleum,Afsarwala mausoleum and Bu Halima's mausoleum. and make no sense to separate it or rate it separately. It's like big park with walls and buildings. good place to rest on sunday morning.special entry fee for foreigners: 600rupees.

Name: Kumar G
Title: Restored gem
Review: On the last day, as we had time to spare, we visited Humayun's tomb, which is undergoing restoration.  It is slowly rejuvenating

Name: FirenzeMamma
Title: Don’t miss this if you’re in Delhi
Review: This is a wonderful building, less visited than some of the other highlights of Delhi. It’s a great example of Mughal architecture which anyone interested in such buildings should definitely make the effort to see.

Name: Bidule05
Title: Isabelle (France)
Review: We visited the Mughal Emperor Humayun's garden tomb, which is a UNESCO World Heritage, being built in 1570. It's the first garden tomb, that has been built in India.We were impressed by this dazzling octogonal mausoleum in the early Mughal architectural style. We saw that the mausoleum was surmounted by a double dome 42.5 meter high, clad in marble with colonnaded kiosksAltogether, I highly recommend to visit wonderful Humayun's garden tomb, whose early Mughal architecture will later lead to the construction of the Taj Mahal!!!

Name: Country adventurer
Title: A beautiful place to spend a pleasant day
Review: The place is actually amazing. u can see the perfection of the architecture and the greenary is amazing. Photographers can have a perfect shot.A great to visit with friends as well as  family.The complex is clean.

Name: aur1408
Title: Monument looks amazing with lights
Review: Recently ASI has done excellent work by doing lighting to the monument. It is till 9pm . Mist visit when you are in delhi . Nearby you can also visit Sundhar Nursery

Name: skagarwal74
Title: Good architecture
Review: Nearest metro station to Humayun Tomb is JLN stadium.Ticket for 35 can be purchased using mobile scan and pay also.The Tomb and the garden around is beautiful and well maintained. The place is attractive and good for photography.

Name: Amit mehla
Title: Good
Review: Humayun tomb was very good and its was very near to metro station also it's outer delhi so you can't face any traffic

Name: MedhaviG
Title: Must see
Review: This tomb is just as grand as the Taj Mahal, and it’s history is just as interesting. Must visit when in Delhi.

Name: Gur Jeff H
Title: Well worth the short visit and photo-op
Review: Also known as the Mini Taj Mahal. This site is well worth visiting. You must have cell phone reception the only way to buy tickets is via cell phone now. There are guides inside that will show you around for a tip. The inside is impressive but neglected, on a good sunny day it's a great photo opportunity. All-in maybe 45 minutes tour.

Name: Veronica J
Title: Quick tour
Review: We visited this sight and had difficulty purchasing the ticket because we didn’t have cell phone connection. You must buy online and provide Passport for ID. Be aware of staff pretending to help guide you then wanting payment. Was interesting trip and I’d recommend going.

Name: Chanchal
Title: Flawless
Review: This on mentioned that inspired the Taj is magnanimous and beautiful. Imagine a Taj in red sandstone. It is located in one of the busiest parts of Delhi however the moment you go in you Step into a Different world. Must see .

Name: pawandeep@1990
Title: wonderfull
Review: This is a monument that is the model for the Taj Mahal. This is a wonderful Indo-Islamic architecture and is a feast for the eyes. It is a mausoleum and there are multiple tombs inside it of the Mughal Emperor Humayun and his family. But the tomb was also used as a refuge and has seen a lot of blood shed in the past. The last Mughal king Bahadur Shah Zafar hid there after the 1857 uprising. There are many tunnels running under the building leading out from the monument. There are other beautiful buildings around it which are also worth a visit. A building with a green mosaic dome behind the main building is worth a look.You must approach this building by going around the main tomb. The gardens, much of which are being restored are beautiful. It is a declared a World Heritage site. The fact that these buildings have survived the ravages of centuries and multitude of wars is a testimony to their solidity and workmanship.

Name: AjaySingh
Title: Delhi Taj
Review: The Tomb is in central Delhi. It is large beautiful building set in formal gardens. The site is very peaceful compared with chaos of the streets just outside. A visit is definitely recommended if you are sightseeing around Delhi. There is a relatively short walk from the main entrance through the gardens to some steep steps up to the first level of the main building. From here you can get a close up look at the design and intricate work that has been put into the building.

Name: Mudhit G
Title: Historic monument
Review: Humayun's tomb is the tomb of the Mughal Emperor Humayun in Delhi, India. The tomb was commissioned by Humayun's first wife. Its a UNESCO World heritage site. Very beautiful and well maintained. Nice experience.

Name: Shivani K
Title: Mini Taj .....
Review: I went to this place with my friend and with my family as I have a fetish to visit old monument I loved how beautiful this place was........................

Name: sudhirr 2020
Title: Awesomeness
Review: .....It's simply wow....Visiting the place is very fantastic always ....It's a great monument build by the mugal rulers......

Name: Udit Bhatia
Title: Heritage in Delhi
Review: One of the most recognized landmarks in Delhi, this is a UNESCO world heritage siteExpansive lawns and gigantic tomb complex makes for a perfect day outing in the capital city

Name: Sans K
Title: Visit to humayun tomb
Review: I visited this place almost twice or thrice with my friends .It is located in Delhi and is constructed in memory of mughal ruler late.Humayun.This tomb is really beautiful and I went for the purpose of clicking pictures as it as amazing scenery .

Name: Jehosh
Title: Must visit in Delhi
Review: A must visit place in Delhi even if you have an one day itinerary. Popularly referred to as the red Taj mahal.One of the well maintained historical artifacts. Good parking area is available. And I went through a cabEntry tickets are 30 for Indians and 500 for foreignersLooks magnificent and with wide area of gardens - one can easily spend 3 to 4 hours here. Good place to click lots and lots of pictures Timing to visit__________Also please visit early morning if you are visiting in April may or hot season. The temperature literally kills and you will find it hard to spend quality time there.I couldn't walk much inside the tomb as I was already tired walking. The main structure itself is about 500 m inside.Will be surely visiting again to explore more.Word of caution:I would suggest to take some snacks with you. Cause I didn't find any eateries inside. Only water was available Even outside the premises, I could find only juice and ice cream vendors.Also for the aged and weak persons, please allot a half day for this place, to explore fully.

Name: Tapanmc
Title: Tomb of second Mughol
Review: Humayun's tomb was built in 1572 by his wife Hamida Banu Begum . It aws designed by Persian architectMirak Mirza Gias .The masuleum was first of its kind which was build on vast garden.From the front it looks like three arches standing side by side with centre one leading in height .White dome risesin the centre behind the arch. Red sand stone and white marble made an wonderful combination .Inside main room tomb of emperor Humayun covered with white marble . This simplicity made the site greater and quieter .There are other tombs in the complex.Those are of  Prince Darashiko son of emperor Shahjahan and wife of Humayun .The green lush all around is well maintained .

Name: Polo_and_Marco
Title: Delicate and intricate tomb
Review: The Humayun’s tomb is such a delicately and intricately carved building adorned with semi precious stones and inlays. The gardens are reasonably kept considering the amount of visitors. Be prepared to queue to get tickets.It took about 30mins to walk from JML stadium tube station.

Name: Rahul G
Title: Tomb
Review: As the name suggests, it's a monument. It is not that affluent as the other mughal buildings of the later centuries. But worth a  visit.

Name: Pooja
Title: Ezee phone customer care number ☎️ 8597854416/8597863928 all problem solve and money refund
Review: Ezee phone customer care number ☎️ 8597854416/Ezee phone customer care number ☎️ 8597854416/all prob

Name: travelnomadNZ
Title: Architects dream historic site
Review: Popular tourist and people of India attraction. I love these historic sites especially those that can be an architects challenge. To build it in 1570s against all odds it still stands today.Hints : if you love historic sites best to see them on a cultural your or guided tour. Book in advance can be very popular. Cold in December w ear warm clothes. Bring your camera. Ask if it's okay to take photos.

Name: Mohit behl
Title: nice place for shoot for couples pics
Review: nice historical building from older times , when u go too this place early morning u can find few peacocks also if ur a nature lover best place

Name: SAROJ8585
Title: THE  HUMAYUNS TOMB
Review: The Humayuns tomb is located in Old Delhi.The closet metro station to the monument is Jorbagh on the yellow line.It is one of the most magnificent tombs built in Delhi during the mughal rule.It is an excellent example of perssian architectire.It was commissioned in1526.Its structure is made from red sandstone and the tomb has been made with black and yellow marble

Name: Anjan Sengupta
Title: Nice Building and Garden
Review: This historic building in Delhi is one of the most beautiful and well maintained by AAI. The building and the garden gives a great feeling irrespective of your level f interest in the history behind it.

Name: Sherry G
Title: pre-cursor to the Taj - A MUST SEE
Review: loved this building, a definite must see in New Delhi. Beautiful color and gardens to stroll around.

Name: AL SAMI FOODS
Title: An Epitome of Grandeur - Mughal Era Dynasty
Review: Humayun's Tomb is as remarkable as taj mahal in my view  and it was constructed by Mughals It is the tomb of the Mughal Emperor Humayun in Delhi, India. The tomb was commissioned by Humayun's first wife Empress Bega Begum  in 1569-70,and designed by Mirak Mirza Ghiyas and his son, Sayyid Muhammad,Persian architects chosen by her. It was the first garden-tomb on the India and is located in Nizamuddin East, Delhi, India Its grandeur and construction gives you the glimpse of persian architecture and mughal dynasty  inclination towards the islamic artsI recommend a visit to this amazing tomb  which is full of history

Name: Ronald L
Title: Predates the Taj Mahal
Review: Visited Humayun’s Tomb, constructed in the 16th century.  Son brought in 6500 mogul artisans to build the tomb. Mom did not like the way the job was going and brought in 500 Muslim artisans. Tomb of the 2nd Mogul king. Tomb shows onion shaped Persian dome, lotus flower columns of the Hindus and the eight-sided shape of the Mongols (Chinese). First building with a double dome. If you go to the Taj Mahal you will note the similarities in construction techniques.

Name: Karen P
Title: Grand proportions & open gardens make this a relaxing oasis
Review: This garden tomb precedes the Taj Mahal and although is not as lush with decoration, a visit is important as an early example of this type of Murghal architecture. I found it very peaceful place to walk around.

Name: Smokey128
Title: Beautiful Persian architecture
Review: We did a quick visit to this beautifully proportioned building and beautiful gardens. Truly been blown away by all these quiet oases in a place like Delhi. The architecture is beautiful and it’s lovely to see that the tombs and mosques are all being restored. This restoration work also has included the Garden Tomb of Isa Khan the only surviving octagonal Royal tomb. It and it’s gardens have been magnificently restored to its former glory.

Name: sawhneysaab
Title: Nice architecture
Review: This is one of the very old monuments situated in the state of New Delhi. Do visit if you wish to see it.

Name: Ayush
Title: Finest Indo-Persian Architecture
Review: Humayun tomb is an UNESCO world Heritage site and one of the finest examples of Indo-Persian Architecture. Whenever you go there,there is something that soothes you and create a feeling of Goodness. With over 300+ tombs(approx) it is one of the largest tomb complex in India. Made by his wife Hamida or his son Akbar (Historically not clear) It has Islamic elements such as charbagh patterns,quranic verses on entrance and on tombs,Arch and some Rajput elements such as canopies and some sort of designs. Idea of Taj Mahal was  also inspired by this Monument.

Name: MWandAW
Title: Impressive medieval Mughal and Persian Architecture
Review: My wife and I visited the this very historic complex in March 2020 as part of our luxury guided tor of India. The area is huge, so wear good walking shoes, a hat  and sunscreen. There are limited toilet facilities and no shop. This is a UNESCO World Heritage site so it's really worth a visit. Humayun’s Tomb was built in the 1560’s, with the patronage of Humayun’s son, the great Emperor Akbar. Persian and Indian craftsmen worked together to build the garden-tomb, far grander than any tomb built before in the Islamic world. Humayun’s garden-tomb is an example of the charbagh (a four quadrant garden with the four rivers of Quranic paradise represented), with pools joined by channels. The garden is entered from high gateways on the south and from the west with pavilions located in the centre of the eastern and northern walls. There are a number of graves in the main tomb building. Windows are beautifully decorative and bring a level of mystique to the ambiance of the building. A visit here is highly recommended.

Name: R1chardN
Title: A Beautiful Mausoleum
Review: We visited Humayun's Tomb as a part of a City and highlights tour of Delhi.  You need to have a guide to get the most of these monuments.It is a UNESCO Work Heritage site and a 'must see' when you are in Delhi.  This is the fore runner to the Taj Mahal and should be seen before the Taj.There are a greater number of graves here than at the Taj and there is a far greater use of colour but many of the archeological features are the same.

Name: Paul T
Title: A prelude to Agra
Review: Sets the tone for what’s to come. Visit here first then work your way through the monuments in Delhi then off to Agra and finally Jaipur!

Name: DP1066
Title: Impressive!
Review: Another ‘must visit’ is this UNESCO World Heritage site.  This houses both Isa’Khan and Humayan’s 16th century tombs, which were the inspiration for the Taj Mahal.

Name: Parwani K
Title: Morning visit at humayuns tomb
Review: This is first garden tomb in Asia and built before and tajmahal. Tajmahal is humayuns tombs replica in marble. Very beautiful place in Delhi, photographers delight.

Name: Debbie P
Title: Just breathtakingly beautiful
Review: I had never heard of Humayun's tomb....we visited as part of a tour around Delhi - it took my breath away.  It really is one of the hidden secrets of India.  Not as busy as the Taj Mahal, but just as beautiful,  one of the many hidden highlights, cannot recommend it more.....

Name: Brun066
Title: The first of the great Mughal mausoleums
Review: Humayun (1508-1556), to whom this mausoleum is dedicated, is the second emperor of the Mughal dynasty. At the time the capital city of the Mughal empire was Delhi; after him he will migrate to Agra (and for some periods also to Fatehpur Sikri and Lahore), whence it will return to Delhi only in 1638, with Shah Jahan.But when it returns to Delhi, the new capital will have its center in the Red Fort and the Grand Mosque area, then this mausoleum (whose location had been dictated by the proximity to the shrine and residence of the highly venerated Sufi monk Nizamuddin Auliya , 1238-1325) will remain peripheral and forgotten. The chronicles tell us that already in the eighteenth century the mausoleum's garden was occupied by informal settlements. The layout we currently appreciate took place after the 1960s, and especially after 1993, when the monument was declared a World Heritage Site. So the story of this building is a story of violent ups and downs, which fortunately has preserved the essentials of the original architecture (but not of the surrounding gardens, completely canceled and only recently restored in a form that vaguely recalls the original one ).Hence the bare character of the rooms that are visited: these are rooms that have been deprived of their original furnishings during the long period of decline and abandonment.Since the buildings completed during the rule of the two first Mughal emperors, Babur and Humayun himself, are not very relevant, this building, intended for the burial of Humayun but not started by him, is the first of the great Mughal mausoleums and in general the first of their great architectural initiatives. Although the author of this tomb is the most eminent of Humayun's widows, Bega Begum, the era of construction is attributable to the reign of Humayun's son and successor, the most powerful and memorable of the Mughal rulers, Akbar, known above all as builder of Agra Fort and of the admirable new capital Fatehpur Sikri.Compared to these wonderful creations, Humayun's tomb (which actually houses many tombs also of other members of the imperial house) appears as an archetype, as the first proof of construction models which will then be gradually perfected; but which is already somewhat perfect in itself. Already in it you can see some solutions, mostly from Persian and in general Central Asian architecture (and in fact the architects, called by the widow, are Persians), but which are new to India: the large central dome which covers the tomb chamber and which stands on a raised large platform; the dome built by white marble, which contrasts with the red sandstone prevalent in the remaining parts; the walls opened by large arches called "iwan"; the surrounding "Charbagh garden", a quadrilateral Persian garden, divided into four-part channels that symbolize the four rivers of Paradise mentioned in the Qur'an.Going inside the building allows you to appreciate, in addition to the large (and now bare) central room, the four smaller octagonal rooms that symmetrically surround it (actually there are eight, because they are arranged on two floors), the smaller rooms that in turn surround the larger ones. All this creates a lively, amazing interconnection of volumes.. And going through the garden allows at least to imagine its ancient magnificence.This monument, located in a corner of Delhi which is now somewhat secluded, is a fundamental chapter in the history of Mughal architecture; and, I would say, also of world architecture.

Name: davemartin3
Title: Superb
Review: An amazing piece of architecture with a really interesting history. Set in lovely grounds so although it was quite busy it never felt crowded. Certainly one of Delhis night lites.

Name: Greeneyedhiker
Title: Lovely afternoon walk
Review: I would definitely recommend this place to visit when in Delhi. The area is beautiful and very picturesque. Just a warning, the price is 40 rupees for a local, but 600 for foreigners. You could easily spend a couple of hours there walking around the gardens and tomb, chilling and taking pictures. They don't have a shop once you get in, so bring water and snacks with you. We went in the afternoon, but the view is meant to be lovely once it gets dark.

Name: Gregory B
Title: Breathtaking
Review: Part of my Chaman Duggal tour. Amazing historical site. I highly recommend this place! A must for your trip to Dehli!

Name: Sheena P
Title: Well worth visiting
Review: There is such a wealth of monuments and buildings to visit in India that it can a bit overwhelming but this one is a must. The scale is huge but this does detract from its beauty. As always, a guide is invaluable as there are so many questions to ask! Not too busy, so visiting was quite peaceful and unhurried.

Name: AZCasualTraveler
Title: Facinating Tomb for Emperor Humayun
Review: The Tomb for Emperor Humayun is a large elaborate complex honoring the second Emperor of the Mughal Empire - including the area that is now Afghanistan, Pakistan, Northern India and Bangladesh.  To get to the Tomb stucture itself, you must pass through several large and ornate gateways.  The "Tomb" was designed after the Taj Mahal in Agra - with a long walkway leading upto the structure that is similar in design to the Taj Mahal.  Very ornate design both inside and outside - very nice structure.Nearby the Humayun Tomb is the Isa Khan Tomb which is not as large or as elaborate at the Humayun Tomb but still a nice place to visit since both "Tombs" are located just steps apart.

Name: gardenerlove
Title: Humayun's Tomb
Review: It is such a vast site, with wonderful grounds and beautiful marble work. It is worth a visit if one has time.

Name: Sh12014
Title: Beautiful building
Review: Very interesting place not only the building but also the wildlife, deer, monkeys, birds. The grounds were kept immaculate. Well worth a visit.

Name: Ayushi Dixit
Title: Mini taj mahal
Review: I went to this place with my friend and with family as i have a fetish to visit old monuments. I loved how beautiful this place was but it deserves a little more maintainence and it ll be even more prettier. Worth a visit if you are in delhi.

Name: Adamthegardener
Title: Group visit while on the tour of the Golden Triangle
Review: This was the very first visit on the tour of the Golden Triangle. A terrific visit well worth taking the time - requires 1-1.5hrs. A 16th Century tomb built by Haji Begum, senior wife of Humanyun, the 2nd Mughal Emperor. It is early Mughal architecture.

Name: Enkhtuya
Title: Tomb
Review: Comparing to Taj Mahal, probably not much beautiful. but absolutely interesting and beautiful point to stop by.

Name: Sisibutch
Title: Gorgeous monument
Review: We spend a few hours here and really enjoyed it.  Took some great photos.  It is definitely worth a visit and glad we managed to fit it in.

Name: John
Title: Nice tomb
Review: Looking so nice and beautiful,look like similar of Taj Mahal ,place is beautiful and clean,it is historical place.

Name: gfsc5
Title: Taj Mahal inspiration
Review: If you can't get to Agra to see the Taj Mahal then this is probably the best alternative.  A beautiful tomb set amongst a large park area.  Some great photo ops.  Get lots of shots of the outside.There are some very steep steps to negotiate to enter the tomb area itself.  There are some nice views from up here of the adjacent barber's tomb and a bit of a sight of a lovely Jain temple.Humayun's tomb has a tomb in the centre of the building with a few more in adjacent rooms.  It's not a fancy place but quite peaceful inside.  The highlight for me was the domed area just before the main tomb area.  Take the time to look up.One of the must see places in New Delhi.

Name: Mike X
Title: The other building in the back is more interesting
Review: The structure itself seems mostly restored so the outside decorations are not as intricate as some other structures. Don't fall for the friendly people inside who offer up information when you walk in. They'll ask you for money for the "tour".There is a smaller blue domed structure near the back of the complex that has more impressive outer decorations.

Name: Karan S
Title: Historical relevance
Review: Humayun tomb has historically  relevance  and is a place history  buffs must visit. With the monument  opening  now at night as well and up-to certain point

Name: Manish N
Title: Woww
Review: Built I 1860 this garden tomb was built  in honor  of the second mughal emperor.  Whilst it's nowhere near as spectacular  as the Taj Mahal there are a lot of similarity between the two and its interesting to wander around to view both the gardens and buildings

Name: Alexa M
Title: Beautiful site
Review: We were very glad we made this part of our one day Delhi Tour! It was beautiful and we felt very relaxed walking around.

Name: SHEKAR M
Title: Birthday
Review: Very beautiful place. Could not take pictures inside tomb. Amazing structure , the workmanship of this structure is unbelievable, knowing the time frame it was built without all the equipment we have nowadays, continue to amaze.

Name: SallyRY
Title: Worth a visit
Review: This was a lovely oasis of calm in busy Delhi. The gardens are well looked after and after walking through various gateways you reach the tomb itself which is beautiful.

Name: mayur@
Title: Woww
Review: It's amazing visiting here always.... This monument remind me of tajmahal. It's very great art of mugals .....

Name: Anil
Title: Wow
Review: It's NYC to visit this place ...This monument is very NYC a great epic from mugals....It has small market near which is very nice
